definition: to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts
to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Because I can play the seesaw in the park.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我能在公園裏玩蹺蹺板。

sentences.english: The boy keeps the seesaw in balance.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩兒讓蹺蹺板保持平衡。

sentences.english: Simply by using your finger right here, it's like a little see-saw.
sentences.chinese: 只要把手指放在這裏，就像是蹺蹺板一樣。

sentences.english: You can see a seesaw in it.
sentences.chinese: 在花園裏，你可以看到一個蹺蹺板。

sentences.english: their seesaws always went up,but they never came down.
sentences.chinese: 他們的蹺蹺板總是起來，但是從不下去。

sentences.english: The emperor passes decree, enrol emperor's son-in-law than seesaw.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝傳旨，比蹺蹺板招駙馬。

sentences.english: Their seesaws always went up, but they never came down.
sentences.chinese: 蹺蹺板一頭壓下去就再也起不來了。

sentences.english: The children often teeter in the park.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們常在公園玩蹺蹺板。

sentences.english: Much like a teeter-totter, one's life goes through periods of harmony and periods of difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 就象蹺蹺板，人生會經歷和諧時期和困難時期。

definition: to cut ties/to disconnect/out of touch
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to charge and break through enemy lines
Santimen township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
